com.mesosphere.sdk.scheduler.plan

Interface Step

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Element, Interruptible
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractStep, DeploymentStep, DeregisterStep, EraseTaskStateStep, RecoveryStep, ResourceCleanupStep, TaskKillStep, TLSCleanupStep, TriggerDecommissionStep, UninstallStep

    public interface Step
extends Element, Interruptible
    Defines the interface for a Step of a Phase. The Step is the base unit of a set of tasks to perform, such as launching a Task, updating a Task, or reconciling Mesos state with Framework state. A Step may be in one of five states: PENDING, PREPARED, STARTING, COMPLETE, or ERROR.

    See Plan docs for more background.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default java.lang.String getDisplayStatus()
      Returns a user-facing display status of this step, which may provide additional context on the work being performed beyond the underlying progress Status returned by Element.getStatus().
      default java.lang.String getMessage()
      Returns a reasonable user-visible status message.
      java.util.Optional<PodInstanceRequirement> getPodInstanceRequirement()
      Return the pod instance that this Step intends to work on.
      void start()
      Starts the Step, whose Status should be Status.PENDING.
      void updateOfferStatus(java.util.Collection<OfferRecommendation> recommendations)
      Notifies the Step whether the PodInstanceRequirement previously returned by start() has been successfully accepted/fulfilled.

      • Methods inherited from interface com.mesosphere.sdk.scheduler.plan.Element

        forceComplete, getErrors, getId, getName, getStatus, hasErrors, isComplete, isDelayed, isPending, isPrepared, isRunning, isStarted, isStarting, restart, update, updateParameters

      • Methods inherited from interface com.mesosphere.sdk.scheduler.plan.Interruptible

        interrupt, isInterrupted, proceed

    • Method Detail

      • start

        void start()
        Starts the Step, whose Status should be Status.PENDING. This will continue to be called for as long as Element.isPending() returns true.

        See #updateOfferStatus(Collection<org.apache.mesos.Protos.Offer.Operation>) which returns the outcome of the PodInstanceRequirement

      • getPodInstanceRequirement

        java.util.Optional<PodInstanceRequirement> getPodInstanceRequirement()
        Return the pod instance that this Step intends to work on.
        Returns:
        The information about the pod that this Step intends to work on, Optional.empty() otherwise.

      • updateOfferStatus

        void updateOfferStatus(java.util.Collection<OfferRecommendation> recommendations)
        Notifies the Step whether the PodInstanceRequirement previously returned by start() has been successfully accepted/fulfilled. The recommendations param is empty when no offers matching the requirement previously returned by start() could be found. This is only called if start() returned a non-empty PodInstanceRequirement.

      • getDisplayStatus

        default java.lang.String getDisplayStatus()
        Returns a user-facing display status of this step, which may provide additional context on the work being performed beyond the underlying progress Status returned by Element.getStatus().

      • getMessage

        default java.lang.String getMessage()
        Description copied from interface: Element
        Returns a reasonable user-visible status message.
        Specified by:
        getMessage in interface Element
